text:
Hi <@U027BLET13R>
I am a certified SugarCRM developer with expertise in SuiteCRM and HubSpotCRM as well.
And I am looking for any opportunity that allows remote work. I am confident that I can add a great value to your team.
Here is my linkedin profile:
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/ghalib-mustafa/>

Please feel free to ping me, if you have any questions.

Hey <@U030G0N31R8>! That is one way to set a CSP. However, it’s a little less common, because it can only apply to content after that `meta` tag is processed.

The more common way to check your CSP, and how HubSpot handles it, is to check the response headers for the network request that loads the page. Here’s a screenshot of where to find it, and a quick article <https://blog.bluetriangle.com/how-to-find-out-if-a-site-has-a-content-security-policy-csp-deployed|here> with exact steps to track it down.
